Name.label: Hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy type 5
Autosomal dominant hereditary axonal motor and sensory neuropathy

TextSection.Contents: Hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy type 5 is a rare axonal hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy characterized by slowly progressive distal muscle weakness and atrophy with or without sensory loss resulting in difficulty in walking, foot drop and pes cavus, that may be associated with pyramidal signs (extensor plantar responses, mild increase in tone, brisk tendon reflexes), muscle cramps, pain and spasticity.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy type V
